data.fullContent: The word "X-ray" is short for X-radiation. X-rays are a form of electromagnetic radiation. They are used in diagnostic machines to look at the internal organs of the body. Here's how it works: The rays are sent from the machine. The rays pass through the body. Some rays pass through normally, but some rays are absorbed by the parts of the body, such as bones. The rays are recorded on film or on a computer. Often, a contrasting material is put into the body before the X-ray to make certain areas stand out better on the film.

q2.translation: x射线是x射线辐射的缩写。x射线是一种电磁辐射。它们被用于诊断机器，以查看身体的内部器官。它的工作原理是这样的:光线从机器发出。光线穿过身体。有些光线可以正常穿过，但有些光线会被身体的某些部位吸收，比如骨骼。光线被记录在胶片或电脑上。通常情况下，在x射线照射之前，会将对比材料放入人体，以使某些区域在胶片上更突出。

q2.middle: The rays pass through the body.
q2.ending: Some rays pass through normally, but some rays are absorbed by the parts of the body, such as bones. The rays are recorded on film or on a computer. Often, a contrasting material is put into the body before the X-ray to make certain areas stand out better on the film.

options.sentence: X-ray machines are usually very complex and require special certifications to use.
X-rays are a form of electromagnetic radiation that is used to look at the internal organs of the body.
A typical X-ray scan usually takes only a few minutes, but depends on the area of the body being scanned.
X-rays are often used in dentists' offices to examine patients' teeth.
